Question.Text: A 26-year-old German student presents to the clinic because of an itchy swelling on her left leg. The skin surrounding the swelling is slightly hyperaemic. The boil is covered by a blackish scab

Answer: This presentation is suggestive of a tropical myiasis (furuncular myiasis) or a cutaneous anthrax lesion, but the central black eschar with surrounding edema most strongly indicates cutaneous anthrax.
